Retrieved 22 October 2015. | website = }} Delfzijl is a small city and former municipality in the very north of the Netherlands, in the province of Groningen. It has around 25,000 inhabitants. It has the fifth most important seaport in the country. Since 2021, it has been part of the new municipality of Eemsdelta. ==References== ==Other websites== * (in Dutch) * * Category:Port cities and towns of the North Sea Category:21st-century disestablishments in the Netherlands Category:Cities in Groningen (province) Category:Former municipalities of Groningen (province) Category:Eemsdelta
title: Delfzijl
